channel.title: Basics of Statistical Programming and Data Manipulation (W35-36) on Social / Business Data Science 2023
channel.description: Recent content in Basics of Statistical Programming and Data Manipulation (W35-36) on Social / Business Data Science 2023

item.title: Introduction to Data Science
item.description: This session will introduce students to the fundamentals of data science, with a focus on Python. Topics covered will include Python data science libraries and frameworks, essential tools and platforms, data handling and manipulation, exploratory data analysis and essential statistics, data visualization, and more. Students will have the opportunity to practice the skills they learn through hands-on exercises and projects. Part 1: Welcome Students! This session sets the stage for your data science journey:

item.title: Exploratory Data Analysis and Essential Statistics
item.description: This session introduces students how to use Exploratory Data Analysis and some fundemental concepts of statistical methods to uncover patterns, anomalies, and frame questions in data. Students will learn foundational measures and techniques for data interpretation, and they will have the opportunity to apply EDA and statistical methods on datasets through hands-on exercises. Part 1: Exploratory Data Analysis & Essential Statistics Deep Dive into EDA: Uncover patterns, anomalies, and frame questions.
